title: Santa equality with visiting family?
body:

They are just the type of people that will live paycheque to paycheque buying frivolous stuff and spend a mortgage payment on their kid for Christmas.

This is the first year we are doing Christmas morning together in a very long time and haven't done it together since having kids. Anyways, I would say I err on the side of "normal" when it comes to gifts for the kids. I think. I typically do 5-6 gifts plus stockings but one gift is always a book and one is usually clothing. My kids are still young enough that their needs are always met and they aren't asking for outrageously expensive things
However, I know our visitors go completely overboard. And my kids are still young but they will certainly notice the difference between them getting 5 gifts and their cousin getting 20. I tried to nicely explain that I would feel bad if my kids had to watch their cousin unwrap triple the amount of gifts and wonder why Santa was so good to her compared to them. So multiple times I have asked for an estimate on how many gifts they planned on giving their daughter and how many Santa would bring and it was just...weird. like they have just dodged the question or are so vague that I can't even get a read on if they're giving 5 gifts or 10 or 20.

  I figure I would rather buy some cheaper gifts like a puzzle or cheap book and wrap them for my kids so that it at least appears equal-ish when it comes to unwrapping gifts...but they won't even tell me a rough estimate! Am I wrong for wanting to make it look "equal?" Would this question offend you or is there a reason they are so reluctant to tell me?! WWYD?

I went to college and I‚Äôm graduating soon with my masters. One of my best friends got started pretty young on the kids thing. She had her first at 18/19 years old. her second at 20, and is now pregnant with her third at 23. My other best friend who I grew up with and was the MOH in her wedding last year got pregnant soon after her wedding and is expecting her first soon. My other best friend who I also grew up with had her first a couple years ago and just found out she‚Äôs pregnant with her second. 

I don‚Äôt feel completely ready to have kids yet. To me we are so young, and I‚Äôm about to get my masters so I haven‚Äôt had a real full time job all this time since I‚Äôve been in school. I feel like I need time to get started in my career, pay down debt and get some savings going. I want us to be financially stable. But I have also seen how it has worked out just fine for my friends who didn‚Äôt wait to be financially stable before having kids, and they have been motivated to work even harder for their kids and they are already ahead of me as far as owning a home and having careers. I know it‚Äôs not a competition but it just goes to show how having kids doesn‚Äôt hold you back in the way a lot of people tell you it does. 

I‚Äôm worried my kid is gonna have no one to play with at this point lol. I have 2 siblings and one of them is really young, and the other is older but doesn‚Äôt ever want kids. My husband is an only child. So the idea that my kids will grow up with cousins is a little far fetched. I think the kids they will see the most will be our friends‚Äô kids. 

I just don‚Äôt know. Waiting probably seems like the best course of action, I don‚Äôt think we can go wrong with waiting until we are more financially stable, more mature, and more ‚Äúin that place.‚Äù I‚Äôm not really in a rush, but damn since everyone around me is already jumping into parenthood it makes me a little sad that I am missing that opportunity to experience it at the same time as them, and it makes me feel a little left behind from my peers. So what should I do? What can I do to handle this frustrating situation? I always talk gently to the kids but the parents sitting right there and doing nothing gives me zero authority. title: I am a miserable bad mom
body:
My daughter is two weeks old. I had a breakdown because the usually very helpful mom Facebook group I‚Äôm in asked people to post their favorite quarantine pics with their babies. Everyone looked so happy. I haven‚Äôt taken a picture of myself with my daughter because my eyes are red and my cheeks are constantly tear stained. I‚Äôm always frustrated. I realized I‚Äôm not happy. I‚Äôm not enjoying the newborn phase and I know it doesn‚Äôt get easier. I hate breastfeeding. I hate the crying. I‚Äôm so exhausted. I feel horrible and guilty, and know my daughter deserves someone better. Someone who is happy. I don‚Äôt know how to change.

Edit: thank you everyone for your responses. I truly appreciate them all, I‚Äôve read every single one. I‚Äôm so glad to have a community like this. I know social media is deceiving, and the thing that really got to me was that I couldn‚Äôt even muster enough to fake a happy picture (I know plenty of those smiling moms also are struggling, but the irrational part of my brain is making me think it‚Äôs just me). 

I hate how demanding breastfeeding is at night, during the day I don‚Äôt mind the bonding, and we have supplemented with a bottle to help her gain weight when she wasn‚Äôt gaining appropriately (she is now though). My pump was delayed with the craziness and comes next early week and I‚Äôm hoping to be able to exclusively pump and bottle feed so my husband and I can split nights up and get longer stretches of sleep. 

My husband has been a hero in helping, honestly I‚Äôd be so lost without him. He‚Äôs taken many feedings with the bottle, changed diapers, tried to soothe her all so I could sleep a little more. He‚Äôs put us both down for naps some days, and he checks in on how I‚Äôm feeling. He‚Äôs made sure I‚Äôve been able to shower daily, and that I always have a good meal. I feel guilty over this too, because I know he has moments where he struggles too and I can‚Äôt help him more. 

Unfortunately with the quarantine no one is allowed to come over to help since we‚Äôve had to leave to visit the pediatrician after she was born and have no idea if we had been exposed and are asymptomatic ect. The isolation part has also really gotten to me, I can‚Äôt introduce her to my parents (and this is their first possibly only grandchild), I can‚Äôt get newborn pictures, I can‚Äôt take her into town for a walk, she can‚Äôt meet my friends, I can‚Äôt run to grab coffee, or even take a ‚Äòbreak‚Äô and grocery shop. I know everyone is sacrificing right now, but it really did start to get to me over the last few days. I miss my parents, and it breaks my heart they haven‚Äôt met her and I have no idea when they will.

She said she would call the police to make me go if I didn‚Äôt go willingly. So I said I would go (intending to just go home). 

My mom decided to jump on this [opportunity] to get me to go and said she would bring my sick 6 month old into the hospital with all the other sick people if I didn‚Äôt go in and willingly commit myself. So I went in. 

I was there Monday evening from 6pm to 10:30pm. They (the hospital) took all my stuff away and gave me scrubs to wear and kept me in this holding area until they could evaluate me. They assured me that I would be evaluated that day but I wasn‚Äôt sure. I didn‚Äôt know if that was true or even if I would be able to leave. I thought I was going to lose my job and our families medical insurance, I didn‚Äôt know if I could contact my husband. The hospital let me leave and gave me a list of people to call to get depression help and potentially medicine. 

Basically my mom ruined our relationship by threatening my son, and forcing me to go. She wasted my time, stressed my family out, manipulated me, we‚Äôre going to get this lovely medical bill soon and threatened my job all so she could feel better and tried to get me help. 

Here‚Äôs the thing, I already see a therapist once a week. Yes I attempted suicide in January but that was over a month ago.  I also stopped myself by waking my husband up and having him stop me. 

To top it all off when I got home, my mom told me that she was joking and would not have brought my son into the hospital. And for some reason she thought I would just sit down and talk to her all about my experience.  I‚Äôm currently not talking to her. And I told her to schedule future grandson visits with my husband.

title: If you're having a bad day.....
body:
Do you know that feeling when you wake up in the middle of the night and it‚Äôs cold and your diaper feels heavy. And there are so many strange sounds all around you, and it‚Äôs dark and scary. And you get a hit in your head and it‚Äôs your hand that‚Äôs on its own adventure. And you can‚Äôt control it at all and it flings itself around and scratches your face and pulls at your hair. And your legs start kicking off the duvet, even though you‚Äôre cold as it is and you try to make it stop but they have their own will. And so you‚Äôre lying there completely helpless with flailing limbs that want to do everything, but none of the things you want.

And you can‚Äôt find mom. And you call for her and you find yourself feeling really scared. What if your beloved mom doesn‚Äôt come for you. You can‚Äôt imagine anything worse and you start to cry because you miss her so terribly. You have never felt as alone as this very moment.

And then she is suddenly there. Standing right by your bed and looking at you with worry and love. And she is the most beautiful thing you‚Äôve ever seen. And you grin up at her with happiness and relief. You don‚Äôt think you‚Äôve ever felt as happy as this very moment.

And she picks you up and holds you close. And she smells like herself, and also a bit like you. Like milk and safety and love. And it‚Äôs the best smell in the whole entire world.

And she is warm and safe and soft and her hands caress you and she feeds you and hums your favourite tune. And you love her voice. You‚Äôve known it far longer than you‚Äôve really known her. It has lulled you to sleep and made you laugh and calmed you when you were distressed. It is the most beautiful voice in the whole entire world. 

And you get to lie right up against her and you feel your entire body start to warm up again. And your still cold hand starts stroking her and moves up towards her neck and accidentally scratches her. Stupid uncontrollable hand. But mom doesn‚Äôt get angry. She takes your stupid hand in hers and it turns all warm again.  And this is the best feeling in the world. Right here in mommy‚Äôs arms, with your hand in hers. Even the diaper doesn‚Äôt feel as horrible anymore.

And you feel your eyes getting heavy and you know that everything is okay now cause mommy is here. Your mom. Your wonderful, incredible mom who always looks after you. Night and day. 

You look up at her one last time before you fall asleep. She looks tired and her eyes are closed, and yet she is still the most magnificent thing you know. How amazing that she wants to sit here with you in this moment. How amazing that she will always sit with you for a bit when you need her to.

You smile to yourself. How lucky you were that she became your mom. The most perfect mom anyone could have asked for.
You knew, even before you saw her, that she would be the best thing in the world.

Oh how you love her. Your mom.

title: To the woman at the restaurant that complimented me, thank you. You have no idea how much I needed that.
body:
I am on vacation in the Bahamas with my husband and 2 kids. I feel like I have been surrounded by the most beautiful, confident, thong wearing, well off, women all week.  

Even as a fit teen I never felt confident in a swim suit. Only once since having children did I wear an actual bikini to the beach, without a tank top to hide behind; to which my 7 year old said "mom... Are you allowed to be wearing that?".  

I've put in more effort in the last year, as I near 35, to make heathier choices. I'm not overweight in terms of numbers, but I wanted to eat better, DRINK MORE WATER, and actually try to work out regularly. I haven't lost any weight, but I do feel more toned, and have higher energy.  

Still, I can not feel confident in a more revealing swim suit than the same tankini I've been wearing for 10 years. I am jealous of the confidence of the women around me, especially of the women who have a little (or a lot) of junk in the trunk and can feel comfortable in their gorgeous bikinis. You ladies inspire me!.  

So tonight, our kids had a "kids only" event and my husband and I went out for a date. For the first time ever, I wore high waisted floral bottoms and a cropped top tank top, allowing for about 2 inches of my midsection to show. It might not sound like much, but it was a big leap for me. I did not feel confident. I held my jacket in front, and folded it in my lap during dinner; constantly checking my waistband to make sure no rolls were oozing over the top.  

After our meal, a female server from the restaurant came over to me and said "I'm sorry to interrupt, but are you a physical trainer? I have passed several times and I just had to ask." I said "uhh, no, I'm not. I teach preschool." In her beautiful Bahamian accent she said "No way, Mama! You got your body TOGETHER! On point!" 

I thanked her, downed my wine, then walked to go pick up my kids in a much better mood than when I had dropped them off.  

Lift each other up ladies, we all need it.

title: Not entirely sure how to handle my cousin's different parenting style.
body:
She and I used to be really close. Since having kids it feels like I've lost someone. We have completely different parenting styles and I help but think her's is detrimental. Not detrimental. I dunno what the word is. She's not actively hurting or neglecting her child. She is a 'good' mother. She has a lot on her plate. Is she doing her best? I guess. 

I can't quite put my finger on what it is that runs me the wrong way about her style. So here's an example from the last time we hung out. 

Over snacks, which I brought to share, I have a 2 year old and a 4 year that are both voracious right now so I almost always have some kind of snack on me. Pretzels and popcorn today. She tells her baby who is going hard on that popcorn.. "No more popcorn." I say. "I have more at home if she wants, I really don't mind." She closes the box and pushes it away from her 2 year old. "Popcorn is gone." My daughter opens the box and starts eating. I don't stop her. Her 2 year old starts to fuss seeing that there is obviously more. "I said no!" Begin a totally expected tantrum. Her daughter starts thrashing. My cousin's gets clocked in the jaw by her daughters head. She calls her a brat.

In my mind. This whole thing was completely avoidable. 

At this point all our kids really need naps. They've been busy all day at the park running and playing and now they're getting a moment of quiet before we leave and take them home for naps.

TO ME: this isn't the hill we die on. It's pre Naptime snack. As long as it isn't candy... Who cares? But whatever I don't say anything. 

Here's another example. Her 2 year old struggles with gross motor play. She needs help climbing. This is what my cousin says. While I'm watching her for an afternoon so her mom can have a break, her and my kids are playing on a climber that is admittedly for older children. Her toddler turns around and just asks to be 'up' instead of even trying herself. So I teach her how. I support each foot as I show her how to use her hands and feet to climb. "Hand. Hand. Foot. Foot." I say as I show her exactly what to do. At the top I support her butt as she climbs over and slides down. The look of pride and joy on her face at the bottom of the slide is just heart melting.  Later that day I'm talking with her mom of course she wants her mommy's attention. So she tugs on her mom and pulls her over to the climber and says. "Up!" My cousin just does it. So the second time the baby does it, I say, "Hey little one, remember we can do this like a big girl?" And I do the same thing. Support her body and feet, giving her instructions on what to do with her hands and feet. Mostly I'm teaching my cousin how to do this. Trying to unobtrusively say that YOU have to teach them to be independent. They won't just do it themselves. (Maybe some will...God help you if you try to help my youngest... But her kid is one of those that would rather be helped.) The next time her baby approaches the slide, she helplessly looks back and says, 'up' and her mom just jumps right in and does it for her... 

I say nothing. But make a mental note not to bother in the future. 

She has other habits that I can't stand now. She refers to her daughter as a brat when she acts like a very normal toddler (throwing her paci or not wanting to help clean up.) She makes comments about the condition of my kids' toys. Many are second hand or generationally passed down. She has plenty of disparaging comment about my parents (something I used to commiserate about before I had kids, but I've learned to appreciate the help I have instead of wishing for it to be something else.) When she's in my house, which used to be my late grandmother's, she always asks about whether or not I've fixed this or that or when I'm going to move or renovate. She complains about her job. She complains about daycare. She complains about having no one to help her (her parents are deceased and her in laws live out of state.)  It's a never ending spew of griping. I can't hardly be around her anymore. I used to look forward to seeing her. Now that she's a mom... I just... Honestly I'd rather take her kid and just tell her to go. I don't have anything in common with her and I can't help but feel that her daughter will grow up to be...mean. I know for a fact the minute she leaves my house she complains about my kids (especially my super overactive and very exuberant 4 year old), or me or my house or all of the above.

It feels like I grew up. And she still hasn't. 

TLDR: how do you mom's deal with a complete difference of parenting styles? Do you hard ignore? I don't feel it's my place to tell her what to do. Not that she would listen anyways. But I also don't really want to spend time with her anymore. If I do that I fell like her daughter is the only one who loses...

title: Terrible Milestone: Our first emergency with LO.
body:
It was terrifying. It started with LO making weird coughing sounds on the way home from daycare.  She kinda gagged and spit up while she nursed with me at home. We thought, maybe she isn't feeling good. Maybe its her first stomach bug. 

Then straight to dinner time. She spits out her solids, and then refuses to eat. She is upset. Maybe she just isn't hungry. Her papa takes her while i finish my dinner. She is just crying a bunch and cuddeling with her papa. She is not typically a cuddler. She is crying hard, and her gaging sounds are getting worse. 

That's when i decided it was time to go to the ER. Something was wrong. What if she had something in her throat? My husband didn't even question me. We just went. 

We race into the car, she is still so upset. Drive towards the ER. But the urgent care is closer. We do a quick turn around to go to urgent care. OMG!! The slow cars just wouldnt get out of the way. It was the longest 8 min of my life. I run in with my LO while her papa finds a parking spot. I am in PJs, wet hair, and flip flops. I slip on the floor running in. As the front desk asks me if i am ok, i just say that i think my daughter is choking. They take us right back. 

I was terrified, but kept telling myself "not yet. You can't freak out yet. Not until she is safe."

Doctor came in, and heard the gagging and shallow breathing. He listened and wanted to wait. I wanted her to calm downa bit, so I tried nursing her. He said because she was still able to nurse, that it was a good sign. It was definitely a partial blockage though. It cleared up on its own while in the center. Whatever it was, it didn't show up on the Xrays. We have no idea what she was choking on. But she is ok. Per doctor's orders, we stayed up all night watching her, just to be sure. 

And next time, we need to **just call 911**...bc they can get to us faster than 8 min. **A partial blockage is an emergency.** its a lesson I hope to never have to utilize in the future though. 

I am so glad this experience is over...

body:
So let me start off by saying
1. this is not a brag, not meant to be.
2. I'm sorry if my issues make some people jealous , this is not my intent. I just need to vent and no one gets it. Everyone thinks I should just be happy to provide well for my baby.

now for the venting!. I Have an over supply issue... Like Way over supply this is my second kid , and the second time I have chosen to 100% breast pump. First kid didn't know how to root, latch or suck , second kid had a bad latch and bit me so badly. So I resorted to pumping because it worked well with the first.. 

With first kid I peeked out at 90 oz / day spread across 5 pumpings .... And no even at 5 pumpings I didn't have trouble with keeping supply up around 90. But that is 9 oz / side per pumping session.... This time I wanted to start decreasing and I have been spreading the pumpings out but the supply isn't going down ... I'm only pumping 3 times a day 5:30, 1:30, 9:30 and I'm going to exploded. ( I have tried most of the weaning tricks and even some of the Whoo-Whoo advice I can find )

this morning I pulled down 34oz.... that is more than I need to feed my son for an entire day . My boobs feel like Hot water balloons not to mention the weight... a 36K weighs approx 5lb / boob . the milk is adding or removing a whole pound per side. Its messing with my balance. 

Lets not even mention how difficult it is to stay hydrated... if your taking out 100oz / day then you have to put that in ... I have to drink 200oz / day just to not get a head ache. that is 12 oz / hr every hour I'm awake I'm so sick of the taste of water! I'm currently paying for carbonated water with flavoring added to change it up. 

My boobs are actively changing multiple cup sizes in one day . they are a 36 K when not filled with milk... I feel like my boobs precede me into any room and they are half my depth and I also feel like they are the only thing people see as they visually change size during the work day. 

my son is almost 4 months old and a saint... but why the oversupply. I know that undersupply can be difficult to deal with but I needed to vent, oversupply can be just as painful and difficult to deal with as well.

title: Toddler has same birthday as MIL.. how would you deal?
body:
So my toddler has the same birthday as my MIL.. also a couple of days before Christmas (double whammy).  Just looking for some unbiased advice on how others would handle it!

A little history; since knowing my MIL, she has ALWAYS had to celebrate her bday on the exact day of her bday (as is her right, but it's super close to Christmas and the season is super busy, so attending always seems annoying since we have to see them two days later for the holidays) and gets upset if we are late/ have other Christmas plans.  She also throws aunts/uncles/nieces/nephews birthday dinners (sometimes they are unwanted) and hilariously complains about the amount of work it is. 

Growing up, for me, birthdays were normally spent with my parents and siblings.  We would have a party normally on a weekend where grandparents and stuff were invited.  I honestly have always imagined just spending my kids birthday with them, doing whatever they wanted to do.. not really having to consider other people on that day. 

Anyway, my MIL is butthurt that we don't invite them for cake on this day (it's also been covid, so we didn't have anyone over) & I'm at a loss of what to do!  I of course don't want to "exclude" her, but I also hilariously feel like I shouldn't have to worry about her feelings of loneliness when I'm trying to celebrate my child?

Also, next year is her 60th and my husband is under the impression there will be a big party for her on that specific day and he wants to pretty much ignore our kids bday and celebrate her?  I personally think that would be weird for a grandparent to plan their birthday party on their grandchild's birthday?

Anyway, I welcome all advice and thoughts!  I want to understand if maybe I need to be more open to combining the birthdays or if it's totally not rude of us to just keep celebrating my sons birthday with just us lol!

title: Why is it as the mom, I have to power through my illness but my spouse doesn‚Äôt?
body:
Rant incoming

This past week I (29F) have been sick with a fever, chills, body aches, a terrible sinus headache/migraine and cough. My husband (30M) works 12 hour days and weekends, so I have been home with our 2yo and our 4mo. All this past week despite being sick, as the stay at home parent I‚Äôve had to power through and take care of our kids, cooking meals and making snack boxes so my husband has food to take to work for his long days, giving my kids baths, doing the bedtime routines, the grocery shopping, the laundry, the dishes, the overnight wakings and feedings with our 4mo. Then a few days ago our 2yo came down with a fever so I was waking up with her overnight too. Finally the weekend came and my husband promised it would be my turn to rest since I hadn‚Äôt had a chance all week, and he knew I was still sick and exhausted. Well, naturally he comes down with food poisoning or some type of stomach/gastrointestinal bug and is having diarrhea and vomiting all night. 

So I continue waking with our infant overnight into the morning and then my husband took over from about 8-10:30. During that time he got both kids up, dressed, fed our toddler breakfast, fed our infant, fed our 2 dogs, let the dogs out and that was it. I wake up to the sounds of him yelling at our toddler to stop fighting him during a diaper change, and him calling me saying he needs wipes because she had a blowout and he doesn‚Äôt have wipes. I bring down a pack of wipes and discover our toddler‚Äôs blowout left poop on our infant‚Äôs sit up chair which is hand wash only because it doesn‚Äôt come apart, and our infant has had a blowout as well in his mamaroo which my husband didn‚Äôt notice. I ask him if he has checked our toddler‚Äôs temp because she has been running 100-102¬∞ temperatures and he admits that no, he hasn‚Äôt but he has checked his and he doesn‚Äôt have a temp of his own. Which good for you but I‚Äôm more worried about our child who can‚Äôt advocate to get medicine on her own if she‚Äôs not feeling well‚Ä¶

My husband then falls asleep on the couch after the diaper change, and I‚Äôm left to hand wash the sit-up chair, and handle the baby‚Äôs blowout and clean the mamaroo insert. While my husband is napping, I empty the dishwasher, bring down and wash all the bottles from overnight, check our toddler‚Äôs temperature, reload the dishwasher, check the baby‚Äôs temperature to make sure he‚Äôs not getting sick, take my own medicine, and get our infant‚Äôs laundry started. Maybe I‚Äôm just looking for a bone to pick but I‚Äôm just feeling so frustrated because it feels like I‚Äôve had to power through this whole last week being under the weather, having no choice because our kids need me, but he‚Äôs home now and he‚Äôs here and capable and I get that he doesn‚Äôt feel good became same, but he can‚Äôt pick himself up just a little bit and show up even a little bit? Like am I asking or expecting too much? Am I being unreasonable or unfair? 

TL;DR 
I was sick this whole past week but because husband works 12 hour days, I had to take care of our 2yo and 4mo by myself while sick. My husband promised when the weekend came, I‚Äôd be able to rest and he‚Äôd watch the kids. Naturally Friday night he comes down with food poisoning or a gastro bug and ends up having diarrhea/vomiting all night and has spent all but 2 hours napping. I‚Äôm frustrated because what was supposed to be my turn to rest is just more of my time spent taking care of the kids while sick and exhausted. Am I being unreasonable or unrealistic in expecting and wishing that my husband power through his illness like I do mine, to parent our kids?

title: Anyone else have a toddler who still doesn't sleep through the night?
body:
Our daughter will be 2 at the end of July, and she's slept through the night a grand total of 4 times. No matter what we do or try (and we have tried literally everything), she just can't do it. Those 4 times were total flukes and we cannot recreate that success.

Not necessarily looking for advice, just commiseration at this point because I'm just tired. It's been almost 3 years, given the pregnancy insomnia issues, that I've been without a full night's sleep. I realized today that I've just accepted that I'll never get a full night's sleep again, and that made me more tired and sad.

I love my daughter and don't blame her for any of this, because I know that as frustrating as it is for me, at least I can reason through it and be logical about things, and she's too small to do that. She's losing sleep, too, and is growing on top of it; that's not easy for her. I just wish for both our sakes that we could fix it. Nobody has any clue why this happens or how to deal with it.

She's always been this way, always 'bad at sleeping.' I was the same way as a child, apparently. It took til I was a teenager to actually sleep all the way through the night without waking up and having difficulty falling back asleep, I just got to the point where I could entertain myself during my insomnia spells. So I mean, realistically I know I'll eventually get a full night's sleep again, if only when she's in Kindergarten and able to deal with it on her own. But still.

Just tired and sad. Please tell me I'm not alone here and that there's hope.

title: I had an epiphany
body:
Sorry if this is long, this is a bit of a rant.

I have been dealing with "mom rage" after my second baby (who turns 1 today!). He is the sweetest little boy, and a decent sleeper, but for some reason once in awhile when he wakes through the night I get this horrible rage and am seething mad. This is not like me at all, and I was so embarrassed. My husband, instead of helping with the baby, would just say "what is wrong with you?".

I decided to join this parenting mental health support group, and last week we were talking about emotions. They said that instead of being embarrassed or suppressing our emotions we should get curious about them and try to find out our triggers. They said you usually aren't reacting to whatever set you off, rather it is a culmination of things and that was just the straw that broke the camera back, so to speak. 

So, last night the baby woke up and he wouldn't go back to sleep and I was getting so rage filled. Except this time I got curious. And I had an epiphany. The only time I get this mad is when my husband is home (he works shift work and is gone a lot of nights) but he is not helping, and I am handling the night waking by myself. 

I am so tired of being a married single mom. He was gone on an overnight trip with some friends last weekend, and it was great! The house was cleaner, I felt more organized, I managed meals and extracurriculars and at the end of every day I went to bed with a clean house, and I wasn't the slightest bit mad when the baby woke up. He asked if I missed him and I said no, I didn't. When he is here I feel lime I am managing 3 kids, except one is a grown-ass adult. It should be easier with two parents, but it isn't. He is so lazy and will try anything to avoid parenting. I am always nagging him to get off his phone and to not just throw on the TV for the kids (my other child is 3). He barely cooks, just the 1 meal a week I make him do. If he is alone with the kids around lunch he "forgets" to give them lunch unless I remind him. I handle all the default parent stuff. He does clean a bit, but half-assed (will vacuum the floor but doesn't put anything away first, will just pile it on the table, for example).

The funny thing is that before kids he wasn't like this. He would clean and cook. We had conversations before we moved in together about the division of labor and he said all the right things. I know I shouldn't let things be this way, but I am so sick of fighting all the time  I am sick of nagging him. It shouldn't be this hard. 

I don't want my kids to have divorced parents, but I really don't want them to grow up in this kind of household and think it is normal. I am just coming off mat leave and truly can't afford to leave right now, so I think I am going to sit him down again and tell him what I have said here, and ask for couples therapy. One last chance. Things will either work out, or else that will give me some time to get some money together. I am so tired of being this angry, bitter mom. I truly thought the problem was me, but now I can see clearly that it is my relationship.

I'm not sure why I am posting this, I just needed to get it out.

title: If you can't beat 'em join 'em, or, "how I found myself wearing adult diapers to cope with the demands of motherhood"
body:
Using a throwaway for this confession of mine rather than my main. I think it'll be clear why.

I have three under three (or close enough, my oldest turned 3 a month ago) and I'm at home with them. For the last seven months my husband has been working extra hours and frequently traveling for work, so it's usually just me holding down the fort. I feel like there's always *something* going on, or someone needs something RIGHT NOW. And that's at home, if I go out to run errands and bring them along I need to have an eye on all three all the time. Honestly, it can be a little exhausting, but I can handle that well enough. What I can't handle is getting to the bathroom when I'm the master of this three ring circus, especially if we're out and about. There have been a few times where I got caught short and wet my pants as I tried to wrangle all the kiddos so I could bring them into the bathroom with me. Needless to say, that was mortifying. So I grabbed a couple depends left over from the last birth and tried wearing them as backup, and it helped, but they were leak prone and I still had to change them soon after which was also a challenge given the situation. After a bit of searching, I've gotten some full blown adult diapers that can usually last me all day if I need them too, or at least until all three are down for a nap and I can change. And honestly, it's been working great...if you can't get a potty break because you're caring for three kiddos in diapers, join 'em and wear a diaper too. At least that's my take. 

\[Edit: Honestly, as insane as it seems, I actually fully endorse the "adult diapers as life hack" strategy for certain situations, and I'll probably use it in the future. I've found that with the right diaper it doesn't bother me. I'm low-key proud of my resourcefulness in finding a solution. But to have to resort to this day in day out tells me my life has lost any semblance of sanity.\]

But seriously, what has my life become, that I'm a grown-ass woman wearing adult diapers everyday because I'm spread so thin and can't get to the bathroom when I need to? I love these little ones, but I feel like they've driven me to insanity if this is seriously what is going on with me. Send chocolate and bourbon...

title: "All you do is try to sabotage me"
body:
So, I just got this sentence this morning. I'm 8 months pregnant, run a business from home, and care for our toddler daughter. My husband has had a bad streak at work for over 2 years now, so he's at work 6 days a week 8am-8pm, I've been carrying all household duties, 99% of childcare, because when he's home he's tired, and growing my company. It's a lot, especially now that I'm pregnant. His problem at work is literally time management. He can't manage to get his tasks done within the time frame, but is not paid for overtime...


Before I got pregnant things were looking up and we've always wanted more kids with short gasps. My husband swore up and down that he'll be home more, that things were really finally going well... well the 1st trimester it all went to shite again. My morning sickness is "evening sickness". He'd get home to me hugging a bucket with our 2yo jumping on me.


2nd trimester he started trying for a promotion, which would help us a lot, but it requires him to finish a few big projects = more time at work... alright, I will manage. During that time I've been sick multiple times, but I keep working through it because we have no alternative/my husband will not take time off. Let me tell you, having a sinus infection that you can't take almost any meds for, while chasing a toddler, while pregnant is a special kind of hell. It takes a lot of mental strength not to complain.


I'm in the 3rd trimester now. I've asked that I'd love to have a bit of time together since there will be no time once baby is here. We've been on literally two dates last year... well Valentines day he was working all day and sick in the evening... promised to make up for it, but I don't think he will. I'd be OK, but he git our daughter really excited too and she still brings it up.


Then it was my birthday... you can guess how that went. Exactly the same. And I didn't complain, at all, I cooked us a dinner and did everything. He's promised to take me out later but again... I don't see it happening. I asked to watch a movie at home... I don't see it happening. 


Our daughter is sick, I can feel myself catching it. Again, I'm fine, I will handle this. I do all the night wake-ups, I'm up with her in the morning, I do all the day activities, while managing work. I get one evening a week where he does the nught-time routine so I can stay sane. Once a week I get to sleep in, usually, that hasn't happened in weeks now.


It took me an hour to get him out of bed today. As it often does when he's stressed. Before he left I asked him if my "sanity evening" is a go today, because I'm honestly exhausted. He looked at me and said the title. "All you do is try to sabotage me. I've spent months telling you how serious it is with my work and you just don't get it. You want all the things to just be how you want them. My eyes filled up and I just left the room. Now I'm writing this while my daughter eats her snack, I got a raging headache from the cold and trying not to cry. 


Cherry on top? I have a low BP and last pregnancy I ended up hospitalised at 8 months in because I kept fainting from overworking myself. I'm just trying to not have that happen again, by asking for help when I feel I'm crossing the line...


I don't know why he chose me to be the enemy when he's stressed. He used to be my biggest fan, he's supported me starting my business, he loves to "show me off" and talk about my successes. How TF have we ended up here?


ETA: we're trying to start at a daycare, but it's really not an option here untill 3yo. And my husband can't change his job, he has a very niche specialisation, and going into a different profession would mean a serious pay-cut, which we can't afford. The promotion should get him into a different line of the same niche work, a but which is much easier for him to time-manage.

title: For the C-section moms‚ù§Ô∏è
body:
Just came across this on Facebook and felt compelled to share here. As someone who is still trying to heal mentally from their birth experience, this one really moved me. It‚Äôs the only C-section post I‚Äôve ever fully related to and loved. 

‚ÄúC-section scar, You are the dark place cut into me that opened into light.‚Äù ‚ù§Ô∏è



Dear C-Section Scar,

I didn‚Äôt want you. I didn‚Äôt plan for you. In fact, I did everything I could to avoid you. But today I touch you with compassion. I smile at you. I send love, grace, and tenderness to you.

You are not weakness. You are not failure. You are not a mistake. You are part of me.

You are not a dead end, the place where my birth journey halted and could travel no further. You are a passage I am still discovering. You are the door that opened to my baby. You are the door that opened into who I am as a mother and as a woman.

Riding over bumps in the car. Laughing and coughing. Bending at my waist. The day I stopped taking narcotics to soften your pain was a milestone. The day I could get out of bed without holding my husband‚Äôs arms and without searing pain was a milestone. The day I could stand up from the rocking chair while holding my baby was a milestone. The day I could sit on the floor to play with my son and make my own way back up to my feet was a milestone. The day I could bend over to pull my underwear up by myself was a milestone. These were milestones I resented. I didn‚Äôt want to have to be passing through these milestones.

I wasn‚Äôt prepared for the numbness. I couldn‚Äôt feel anything when my fingertips touched my own skin in the inches between my belly button and pubic bone. My fingers felt like they were touching someone else‚Äôs body; there was no feedback from my nerves that had been cut. It felt like I was touching something in me that had died.

The doctor cut through six layers of muscle, tissue, and organ to get to my baby. She separated my abs in the middle and pulled my baby through. I have met at least seven new layers within myself because of you.

You are not my whole story of becoming a mother. But I will never know how my birth as a mother would have been different had I pushed my baby out of my vagina.

C-section scar, You are the dark place cut into me that opened into light. You will never be one simple story, but you will always be mine.
.

title: I‚Äôm struggling with my daughters health
body:
I try not to think about it, but this past week I‚Äôve been back to crying every day about it. 

My daughter spent 10 days in NICU. The last day her doctor told us they were still hearing a murmur and wanted us to take hero to a cardiologist the following day. We had one night of normalcy after the most intense sadness I couldn‚Äôt ever describe, wondering if my daughter would even come home, only to find out the next to she had what‚Äôs called an AV canal that will require open heart surgery. 

An AV canal is most common in babies with Down syndrome and specifically trisomy 21, so for my baby without it to have this is very unusual as we don‚Äôt have family histories of congenital heart defects either. She basically has a hole in the upper and lower chambers of her heart, and the main valve that was supposed to be split in two never split, which leads to other problems.

You can‚Äôt tell by looking at her. She‚Äôs growing perfectly and because of that we‚Äôll be able to wait until she‚Äôs older for the surgery, but I still hurt so bad knowing it has to happen and am always questioning why. 

I feel constantly like I‚Äôve failed her. Like it was something I did to put her in NICU and have her heart not formed properly. I get angry that I went in for 5 anatomy scans, specifically to look at her heart because I was going to be induced a month early, once being days before she was born and they didn‚Äôt see the valve. I get angry that something worse could‚Äôve happened during delivery because they missed it.

I get intrusive thoughts of worst case scenarios 

what if she needs more than one surgery

I get horribly, horribly sad, that my baby is going to have to go through such a gruesome surgery and be left with a scar, and then people make me feel bad for being sad that she‚Äôll have a scar. I know it‚Äôll be normal one day, I know it doesn‚Äôt change her, but why can‚Äôt I be sad

I know she‚Äôs needs it, but that doesn‚Äôt mean I have to be *okay* about it. 

I feel like it‚Äôs my fault she has to go through with this‚Ä¶my fault she might get bullied for her scar because kids are mean‚Ä¶.

She‚Äôs beautiful and happy and so strong 

But I‚Äôm so sad. I hate this so much.

title: 10 days postpartum
body:
Tried really hard not to come here and bitch because I didn't want to give in to the negativity, but even though I know so many women feel exactly like I do I feel so alone.

Everything is so perfect! I couldnt ask for a better partner, he is so attentive and helpful even though he is still working from home full time and only got one day off. My newborn sleeps about as well as you could expect a newborn to sleep. My GiL has been here almost every day to relieve me so I can take care of myself. I didn't tear during birth and I'm relatively mobile after just 10 days. I was blessed with an oversupply of milk almost immediately. My sex drive still exists even though I can't really utilize it right now lol. 

The hormone drop has been pretty crazy. I keep joking that all the excess fluid has been removing itself from my body via my eyes. I could cry more than I have been but I'm trying so hard to keep my composure, I hate crying in front of others and there's always someone here helping.

I get SO ANGRY when my newborn wont stop crying, even though it could be only one of like three things for him at this point. I feel very little attachment to him, but I still want to take care of him. I want to love him so badly. He's so cute and vulnerable and I am his lifeline in this world. 

My mom had really bad PPD with me and I'm so afraid of it happening to me. I don't want to go on antidepressants, I hate them so much. I don't think I can emotionally handle PPD. I'm already so emotionally exhausted and I feel like I have this whole thing on easy mode. I feel so weak as a person. I wanted to be a mom so badly but I'm wondering if it was a bad move.  

I feel apathetic when I don't feel distressed. Sometimes I feel joyful but really only during the day. My appetite is gone.

I read baby blues last about 10-14 days, so maybe in a few days I'll come back and read this and feel silly.

For now I just need to get my emotions written down and out in the world.

I gave her milk, changed her diaper and just did whatever I could to keep her calm and quiet because ‚ÄúDad can‚Äôt function without 9 hours of sleep.‚Äù By noon I was exhausted and he was still sleeping. I woke him up to make the baby some lunch because she was stuck to me like glue (she didn‚Äôt feel well, I don‚Äôt blame her). The conversation went like this:

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt cook in a dirty kitchen.‚Äù 
- If it‚Äôs dirty clean it or hold the baby so I can clean it. 
 ‚ÄúShe doesn‚Äôt like me that much.‚Äù
- Well I‚Äôll clean it while I hold her so you can cook.
‚ÄúNobody likes what I cook so I‚Äôm not doing it.‚Äù 

So I get up feeling exhausted and also sick to cook in the ALREADY CLEAN kitchen. I finally get the baby to sleep and she wakes up with a fever. I tell him we need to take her to the hospital and after groaning and asking 21 questions about why she needs to go he gets up and we take her. She had croup and covid. He gets upset at me saying things like ‚Äúhow did she get it?‚Äù and ‚Äúshe must‚Äôve gotten it from your mom because she was fine before y‚Äôall left‚Äù (I stayed with my mom for a weekend last month for my cousin‚Äôs birthday). My mom and little brother have both tested negative three days in a row. Both of his sisters and his mom have tested positive but for some reason it couldn‚Äôt have been them. 

When we got home from the hospital, he called me names, said I only ever talked to him when I need help, told me I was ‚Äútrying to change him‚Äù and accused me of cheating. I asked what he meant by trying to change him and he said, ‚ÄúI told you I wasn‚Äôt going to do any cooking or cleaning I don‚Äôt know why you think anything has changed.‚Äù Then he yelled, loud enough for everyone on the street to hear, ‚ÄúJust take your baby in the house so I can get out of here.‚Äù 

On the first day of the new year he promised he would help me more with the house and the baby and be more supportive of my emotions and dreams/goals. None of that has happened. 
I have no room in my schedule to cheat on him. I work part time, I‚Äôm a full time mom, housecleaner, house chef and grad school is a whole different beast of its own. I get about 4 or 5 hours a sleep per night because I‚Äôm up doing all the stuff he refuses to do. 

I have a really tight sleeping, eating and activity schedule for both of them because he threw a fit for a week stating that ‚Äúhe never knew what was going on‚Äù and ‚Äúyou (me) never know what you want to eat/do‚Äù. The activities and meals are planned out weekly and color coded so we‚Äôre all on the same page. He says I only schedule things he doesn‚Äôt like to do or doesn‚Äôt want to eat but every week I ask him what he wants and he says ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know, you‚Äôre better at picking all that stuff‚Äù. 

He constantly complains about our child not liking him and says I don‚Äôt let them spend enough time together but every time I try to take a shower or even go to the mailbox he says she doesn‚Äôt like him and just lets her run around screaming until I finish. 

He‚Äôs talked bad about me to his friends then complained about me not wanting to be friends with them. He leaves power tools and screwdrivers laying around in the house. He makes messes, doesn‚Äôt clean them up and expects me to keep the house spotless while cooking, working, caring for our sick child and scheduling his life. 

I‚Äôm ready to leave him and I‚Äôm in the process of getting my stuff together financially and legally to do it. He‚Äôs trying to pretend that everything is normal and I‚Äôm just playing along while I get my stuff together because I don‚Äôt want him to flip out on me and I don‚Äôt want to leave without having a solid plan since my child is so young.

UPDATE: We‚Äôre thriving. So glad I made it safely.  : )  I don‚Äôt feel like I‚Äôm constantly being criticized anymore and I finally feel free to make my dreams a reality. And we‚Äôre SO happy.

title: We are ready to say goodbye to our son
body:

The brightest star in the sky. Sometimes, when the other stars are covered by clouds, only Sirius is visible. Even in bad weather, it is still shine bright.

But they said, that brightest star is also emits a very large amount of energy. So it shorten its age.

We can see that the light of Grafin's life is dimmed. His eyes lost their spark.

We know it's time.

--

I would miss you.\
I would miss kissing you.\
I would miss hugging you.\
I would miss snuggling you.\
I would miss sniffing you head.\
I would miss everything about you.\
I would miss you.\

title: Is my best friend jealous of a toddler?

My husband recently got another job, and with 2024 on the horizon, I knew I needed to address this issue with my best friend.

Right after my husband lost his job, I invited my best friend over my house on Wednesday nights for dinner and while it was enjoyable at first, over the course of the last few months, my best friend would come into my house and immediately unload about the work day in front of my toddler, sometimes would have emotional outbursts, and I would take care of them and ignore my daughter. I didn‚Äôt realize how much I was doing this, but I did notice that I was beginning to get uncomfortable around my best friend. I couldn‚Äôt figure out why I was feeling uncomfortable, or distant, and I just kept talking to them as if nothing was the problem. My best friend had done several things over the course of these last three years that have crossed boundaries, the biggest one being posting pictures of my daughter online (I literally cut my dad out of my life because he couldn‚Äôt agree to keep my kid off Facebook), and I never brought it up because I am afraid to. I am having these revelations now, and after speaking with my therapist, she recommended slowly backing away, which isn‚Äôt something that will work with my best friend. They‚Äôre enmeshed in my life, and I needed to inform them that I had to change my behavior.

During a phone call with my best friend on Thursday night, I expressed to them that I had been prioritizing them over my husband and child. To start, I told them that the Wednesday night dinners needed to end because my daughter is going through a sleep regression and having a guest over on the week is really making the process more difficult. Once I said that the conversation got more tense. Eventually, once I said that I need to prioritize my husband and child, my best friend said that ‚Äúhow is that my fault?‚Äù Which is not the answer I was expecting. I stuttered and stumbled over my words. I didn‚Äôt know how to speak to them. They were crying, I just wanted to let them know that I need to put my daughter first, and in between cries they went ‚ÄúI know obviously, it just hurts.‚Äù

I‚Äôm angry, quite frankly. I didn‚Äôt expect this reaction and I don‚Äôt know where to go from here. I‚Äôm not saying anything that isn‚Äôt a fact. I love my daughter more than my best friend because yeah, of course I do. I gave birth to her. She‚Äôs the priority. I haven‚Äôt been treating her like one and I need to make the effort now. 

During the conversation, my anxiety was so high and I didn‚Äôt know what to do, so I just said that we‚Äôre both in a bad place so it makes sense that this confrontation happened. I told my best friend I just needed space to be with my family and to work to heal together. Like I said, things are rough at home right now and I‚Äôve been ignoring my problems to deal with my best friend.

I received texts everyday since that conversation, and I finally told them today we need to talk in person. What do you recommend I say? What is the brain space of someone who is hurt by the sentence ‚ÄúI need to put my daughter first‚Äù? This is my closest friend so to not be allowed the space to focus on my family is just gut wrenching and I just want to simultaneously scream and yell and cry. Why are they acting like this? We went to different colleges and didn‚Äôt talk every day and still called each other best friends over a decade ago, so to ask for space now and to not be given it, I don‚Äôt know what to do.

title: I feel like such a bad mom over my toddler's cavities
body:
Having finally gotten good dental insurance recently, I took my almost 3yo daughter to the dentist for the first time last week. She was so excited to go and have the dentist count her teeth, and she did great, even through a cleaning. I was so proud! And then the dentist tells me she has four cavities. Four. One in each of her first molars. The dentist recommended silver diamine fluoride to halt their growth, and I had to hold my once-happy toddler down because it tasted terrible. She screamed that she wanted to go home. I left shaking, and have cried every night since. 

I'm still trying to wean her. "Boo" is her favorite thing. We've been working on night weaning for a while, and she has a tantrum almost every time she wakes and I tell her she can't have it. I'm interrupting her night routine to brush her teeth after nursing, and she hates the fluoride toothpastes I've tried (I didn't know I was supposed to switch earlier - one of the many things I kick myself for). Tonight I had to hold her down to brush, and she screamed and cried. Her dad laid with her to soothe her, and when I tried to switch back (she sleeps in a crib attached to my side of the bed), she started crying again and said she wanted Daddy. 

I'm devastated and angry - at myself, and at my husband, who hasn't done anything to help with her dental hygiene until this week. I feel so stupid for not knowing that breast milk has sugar, for not knowing about the stupid toothpaste, for every time I gave in an gave her a bottle at night - or even *suggested* it over a boob because I was just so tired. Every time I gave her juice or a lollipop or chocolate milk, her favorite things, feels like I should never have let her have them in the first place. She used to love to brush her teeth and now it's an ordeal every time, and I feel like I ruined the dentist for her when it could have been a good experience. Now she doesn't want to go back. How the hell am I going to get her to go for a cavity check up in three months? 

I just feel horrible and I don't know what to do. I feel so stupid. I was so focused on how difficult weaning has been for all of us, how hard things have been since I lost my job last year, how much I seem to have on my plate despite having a spouse who fully believes he's pulling his weight, that I too often just went with what was easier instead of what was healthy for her teeth, and here I am, crying and miserable and feeling like the worst mom ever.

Edit: Thanks so much for the kinds words and suggestions. I'm feeling a lot more positive today than I did last night. I still feel guilty, but I know what I have to do next!

title: Struggling with my 7 year old
body: So I have a daughter, and I‚Äôm really struggling with her behavior. I feel like the worst mother for admitting that. I want to preface this saying she‚Äôs pretty mature for her age, and doesn‚Äôt really act 7. She‚Äôs wildly on the spectrum of ‚ÄúI wish you and dad would get back together, he let me do whatever I wanted‚Äù to ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt care about him and I don‚Äôt want to talk to him.‚Äù So there‚Äôs obviously a lot of emotions there. She is in therapy, but there‚Äôs a pretty long wait where I live. She had an appointment in early February, and her second one is coming up in the next few weeks. Hopefully our visits can be more regular. Anyways, some context, I‚Äôve been with my guy now for quite some time (a few years now) and he‚Äôs stepped into the father role greatly. He and my son (4) have absolutely no issues and are thick and thieves. But he and my daughter are constantly butting heads. Before he moved in, I was doing the single mom thing and struggling. I lacked consistency and struggled with routine pretty bad. My anxiety would often flair up, and I would respond pretty angrily and shortly with the kids, especially my daughter. Since he‚Äôs moved in, we have a consistent routine, and things are a lot smoother. I don‚Äôt feel like I‚Äôm drowning anymore. However. My daughter is hard to deal with for sure. She can be so mean. She‚Äôs a chronic back talker, she lies, she thinks she always needs to be the center of attention. Her bio dad often fed into this behavior and often ignored our son. However, he‚Äôs been gone for years, and I just want to know when it will end. She will often say hateful things to my boyfriend or her brother. We‚Äôve been trying a bunch of different parenting techniques to help curb her general disrespect, but nothing really works. The biggest problem is the constant back talk for sure. If she doesn‚Äôt get her way, she creates a crisis. Cries over everything. I try my best to bond with her and be there for her, but her constant attitude is so draining. I find it difficult to engage with her because of the constant stress she‚Äôs causing. She also doesn‚Äôt seem to learn from any consequences. She gets in trouble for the same things over and over again, and it‚Äôs baffling because she‚Äôs so smart. For example, let‚Äôs say I ask her to pause a game she‚Äôs playing (screen time is limited, and I don‚Äôt allow YouTube or anything. Just two hours on Wednesday and more lax on the weekends) and ask her to pick up something she left in the floor or something similar. Sometimes she‚Äôll just ignore me. So I‚Äôll ask again a bit more firmly, and she‚Äôll huff, roll her eyes, pause her game with an attitude, maybe mumble something to herself as she‚Äôs doing it. It‚Äôs eyerolly for sure. It‚Äôs just kinda disrespectful in my opinion, because I‚Äôm asking her to clean up a mess she knows she should have taken care of before she even played a game. We generally ground her (no Alexa, no screen time of any kind, she‚Äôs bound to her room and can read, draw and color) for her actions, and the last time it was particularly bad. My SIL had brought my niece (6) over to play after school, before I had to pick up my BF from work, as we‚Äôre a one car family right now. We were just chatting as I was folding and hanging clothes, and the kids were playing in their rooms. I was asking my kids to come put away the clothes that I had hung up/folded. My son is pretty happy go lucky, and is always happy to help. My daughter however, of course had an attitude. She was wearing her high heels that day (my aunt bought them for her, I don‚Äôt know why, but she loves them üòÇ) and I had already told her if she gave any attitude, the shoes were coming off. So I asked her to take her shoes off. She brushed it off, took off the shoes then did what I asked. It was pretty smooth until SIL went to leave and we had to go get BF. I asked the kids to put on their shoes, and she asked why. I told her we had to go grab BF from work and she barked a ‚ÄúNo!‚Äù At me. And I told her that she was grounded for the rest of the day, because she knows better than to back talk. She was so angry, it just got worse from there. She was disrespectful to my SIL as we were leaving the house, just ignoring her while she was talking to her. We get in the car, and she‚Äôs crying. She says it‚Äôs not fair, that I didn‚Äôt even give her a chance, that I‚Äôm a mean mom, etc. I really try to not engage in arguing with her, just a ‚Äúmy word is final, no more talking‚Äù but it didn‚Äôt work. I‚Äôm not perfect, and I did argue back a bit. I told her she did get a chance, I took her heels before I took her privileges away that day. Plus, I shouldn‚Äôt have to tell her over and over again to not back talk me, as it‚Äôs already an established rule and she gets in trouble every. Single. Time. It escalated further, and I told her if she doesn‚Äôt...

title: Postpartum anxiety
body:
Hi moms! Do any of you have any experience with postpartum anxiety?

I was on medication for anxiety for many years, although I'd stopped for a few years before I got pregnant. I was expecting to see my mental health tank while pregnant, but I was pretty stable overall actually.

Since having my baby and going solo on maternity leave, I've felt my anxiety increase in ways that I think are beyond normal new mom feelings. It started with intrusive thoughts, which got more intense and intrusive as the weeks went by (and are so irrational and terrible they are not worth repeating). Now I'm noticing it spike right at bedtime and it comes with physical symptoms like a racing heart and shortness of breath. Last night was the first night I woke up in the middle of the night because I was so anxious (and stayed awake). I'm finding it more and more difficult to emotionally motivate myself to get out so I'm staying in the house for days at a time.

When my anxiety was very high before I was pregnant, it manifested as panic attacks, insomnia, and generalized stress that kept me in the house. I felt worried about things when my baby aS first born but they were rational and didn't control me. Now it feels like the anxiety is taking over, and it feels like it's newly-developed.

I've read a lot about postpartum depression but not so much about this anxiety. Any other moms go through this? What did you do?

We can work on teaching lessons once her mom love cup is filled up and she knows that I am still here and love her unconditionally. 

I should be napping but instead I am in bed crying, feeling like like I've gained a baby boy but lost my little girl in the process. 

For context: I had been on mat leave with our toddler for 18 months throughout the pandemic, with very little help or socialization nearby. Of course we are extremely attached. 

What do you think I should do? If I stay strong through the tantrums will it get better? Open to any and all advice on how to get through this. 

This mom thanks you for the support.



EDIT: Thank you all for taking the time to share your experiences and reassure me that it will get better. Husband has stepped up immensely and is spending all day every day with toddler doing fun activities. In between I am spending as much special time as I can with her and the crying is less and less every day. She is learning to be a big girl, with mom and dad helping her every step of the way. My hormones have leveled out and I'm no longer the sobbing fit I was when my milk came in, thank God. Next week my mom is coming to help and then its going to be just myself and the two babies figuring it out together. As hard as its going to be, I am looking forward to being just the 3 of us so the toddler knows that she is not being taken away from mommy and that she is a vital part of the team, taking care of baby. Until then I'm trying to rest up as much as possible because I know it's going to be the biggest challenge of my life, keeping both alive and happy! Wish me luck!
